definition: to intercept at the net (volleyball, tennis etc)/to block
to block sb's path/to obstruct/to flag down (a taxi)

sentences.english: The blocking technique of shuttlecock is not only a defence technique, but also a scoring means.
sentences.chinese: 毽球运动中的拦网技术既是防守技术，也是得分手段。

sentences.english: The proportion of block is seeing an upward trend.
sentences.chinese: 拦网得分比重有逐渐上升的趋势。

sentences.english: Blocking means attacking in the match and is an important way to score.
sentences.chinese: 拦网是带有攻击性的防守技术，是得分的重要手段。

sentences.english: The service scoring and block level had been improved distinctly.
sentences.chinese: 发球命中率和拦网水平有明显的提高。

definition: to serve the ball/to tee off
women's volleyball/abbr. for 女子排球
to attack/to assault/to go on the offensive/attack/assault/offense (sports)
to spike the ball (volleyball etc)/to smash (tennis etc)
men's volleyball/abbr. for 男子排球
to cast a fishing net/(computing) to go offline
dominant/controlling/strong/opposite: weak, yielding 弱受/to take by storm (military)
variant of 叮嚀|叮咛[ding1 ning2]
